page.title: 12Housing.
page.content: On the southern edge of the area Victorian terraced houses contrast with 1950's style council_owned houses.The Victorian terrace built in the 1890's is substantial and has been described by commentators as full of character. The council houses simply do not blend in with the surroundings which include a Victorian cider manufactory now used as a carpet warehouse. The terrace houses have been tastefully maintained, showing their local bricks and tiles to good effect. Temporary housing accomodation is to be found at 298385. This is the responsibility of Sedgemoor District Council. Each temporary home is described as 'mobile'.Residents await permanent council houses to become available to them.
